authors.name: Pierluigi Giuseppe Manti
authors.affiliation: Università degli Studi di Milano, Dipartimento di Oncologia ed Emato-Oncologia

description:
{"blocks":[{"key":"fg8i3","text":"Despite several protocols having been published in the past in a fragmented way,
this protocol represents a harmonious recollection and reorganization of those,
which proves to be a useful tool for any scientists attempting the culture of human
keratinocytes derived from skin, cornea, thymus, esophagus, etc. in any laboratory.
This protocol is also of utter importance as the generation of engineered skin,
cornea, and thymic mini-organs becomes more and more feasible.


					

				

			

		","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2900n","text":"
	","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

Location of stem cells of human hair follicles by clonal analysis. Cell. 1994 Mar 25;76(6):1063-73. doi: 10.1016/0092-8674(94)90383-2.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2in9q","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7u58h","text":"Majo F, Rochat A, Nicolas M, Jaoudé GA, Barrandon Y. Oligopotent stem cells are distributed throughout the mammalian ocular surface. Nature. 2008 Nov 13;456(7219):250-4. doi: 10.1038/nature07406. Epub 2008 Oct 1.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1fo55","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3vqjp","text":"Droz-Georget Lathion S, Rochat A, Knott G, Recchia A, Martinet D, Benmohammed S, Grasset N, Zaffalon A, Besuchet Schmutz N, Savioz-Dayer E, Beckmann JS, Rougemont J, Mavilio F, Barrandon Y. A single epidermal stem cell strategy for safe ex vivo gene therapy. EMBO Mol Med. 2015 Apr;7(4):380-93. doi: 10.15252/emmm.201404353.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"918rc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f0gcl","text":"Manti, P., Trattaro, S., Ragazzini, R., Castaldi, D., Vozza, G., Coughlan, A., Bertalot, G., Beskardes, S., Tenderini, E., Gjinovci, A., Pezzali, M., Molinaro, L., Sporici, D., Marelli, L., Villa, C., Pece, S., Papotti, M., Ruffini, E., Spaggiari, L., Bonfanti, P., \u0026 Testa, G. (2021). AB012. Transcriptional and chromatin profiling reveals the molecular architecture and druggable vulnerabilities of thymic epithelial tumors (TETs). Mediastinum, 5. doi:10.21037/med.2021.ab012","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":434,"length":14}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fk3fc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dtc30","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"2gt7l","text":"Add    of bovine serum (ThermoFisher Scientific) (DO NOT use fetal calf serum!). ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":50,"length":28}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ccn49","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"8","error_concentration":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":206}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a4g3","text":"Set up one flask at low density to maintain the line (5*10^5 cells at early passages, 10^5 cells at late passages). This flask should reach pre-confluency in maximum of one week and is precious for stock.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Key steps for human keratinocyte cultures (Howard Green Lab)
Key steps for human keratinocyte cultures (Howard Green Lab)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8ktqq","text":"Feeders: irradiate 3T3-J2 feeder cells when attached to the petri dishes (seeding density: 2.5 x 104 cells/cm2) with a total dose of 60 Gy. Avoid using Mitomycin instead of irradiating, as we have observed transient fusion between keratinocytes and feeders under the microscope.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":9,"length":9},{"style":"bold","offset":133,"length":5},{"style":"bold","offset":140,"length":21},{"style":"sup","offset":99,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Key steps for human keratinocyte cultures (Howard Green Lab)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"hhjg","text":"Once irradiated, put the dishes in a 37% CO2 humid atmosphere incubator.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":43,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Key steps for human keratinocyte cultures (Howard Green Lab)
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"4745e","text":"Remove the 3T-J2 medium from the irradiated dishes and plate keratinocytes on the irradiated 3T3-J2 feeder layers dishes with the cFAD medium. Wait until the next day to verify the attachment of the cells onto the layer. If the keratinocytes cells are plated \"in mass\", you will see them disperced in the dish. If they are few, you will see colonies growing in the following days.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"69n8o","text":"Feedings: add EGF at the first and subsequent feedings. Plating efficiency should be fed every four days and stained on day 12 with rhodamine. Mass cultures should be fed every 2-3 days, depending on how fast the cultures are growing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"5omcp","text":"The mass culture should be passed and/or frozen between days 7 and 10 depending on how
well it is growing. Cultures should not be allowed to get confluent but also
should not be kept in culture for more than 10 days before transferring them. It
is best to feed the pre-confluent cultures the day before you plan to pass or
freeze them, especially if the medium is very acidic looking. Count keratinocytes before freezing them and keep this record on the freezing vial/lab book.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"329j6","text":"Trypsinize the mass culture according to the standard procedure.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7t8sr","text":"Count total number of cells. Remove the culture medium and add trypsin/EDTA. Put the dish/flask in a humid incubator   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":117,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8kek6","text":"Pipet the cells up and down until they are almost all detached and puth them in a 15 ml Falcon tube, and add at least 0.5 volume of medium with 10% serum (cFAD) to stop tryptic action. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8g36q","text":"Centrifuge for 5 minutes 1300 rpm for 15 ml Flacon tube (15 min for a 50 ml falcon tube). Discard the supernatant and resuspend cells in fresh medium.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"epeet","text":"Determine the number of cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6orab","text":"For plating efficiency: set up 2 x100 mm Petri Dishes with 10^2 keratinocytes each. After colonies growth, fix the plate with formaldehyde at RT for   and stain the cells with rhodamine A. ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":149,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"f1d81","text":"To amplify secondary cultures: add between 2-5 * 10^5 keratinocytes per 150 cm2 flask.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cvirm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"424ED813AE2A11EE9FCF0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":600,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d81tu","text":"Prepare cFAD medium. The cFAD medium consists of a 3:1 mixture of DMEM and Ham’s F12 medium (Gibco-Invitrogen) supplemented with 10% FETAL calf serum (Gibco - Invitrogen), 0.4 μg/ml hydrocortisone (Calbiochem, VWR), 10-6M cholera toxin (Sigma), 5 μg/ml insulin (Novo Nordisk), 2 x 10- 6 M 3,3’,5-Triiodo-L-Thyronin (T3) (Sigma) as previously described (see references). Human recombinant epidermal growth factor (rhEGF; 10 ng/ml) (QED Biosciences) is added to the culture medium at the first feedings. DO NOT USE BOVINE SERUM.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":51,"length":40},{"style":"bold","offset":133,"length":16},{"style":"bold","offset":182,"length":14},{"style":"bold","offset":222,"length":13},{"style":"bold","offset":253,"length":7},{"style":"bold","offset":316,"length":2},{"style":"bold","offset":413,"length":5},{"style":"bold","offset":502,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b7a05","text":"Freezing:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6lrpa","text":"Change the medium of growing cells one day before freezing.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fcinr","text":"Trypsinize according to procedure above and proceed to counting them.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cc511","text":"Resuspend the keratinocytes cells in cFAD+10% DMSO (concentration of about 1-2*10^6 cells/ml).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"74vra","text":"If freezing 3T3-J2, resuspend the unirradiated feeder cells in 3T3-J2 medium +10% DMSO.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2fcm1","text":"Mix well and transfer about 1.2 ml to a freezing capsule and mark it indelibly (use pencil if cells will go into an isopentane filled box).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"566m5","text":"Pre-freeze the cells at  in isopentane freezing boxes for one night before moving to liquid nitrogen tank   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":24,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":106,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"7a9nl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dv0et","text":"Thawing:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3li2i","text":"Remove the desired freezing capsule from the liquid nitrogen tank. Quickly thaw the capsule in   water bath.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":95,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"n3a6","text":"Transfer content with a Gilson tip into a 15ml tube with fresh 10ml heated cFAD medium to wash the cells for keratinocytes and 10 ml heated 3T3j2 medium for 3T3J2.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"evq8","text":"Centrifuge the Falcon tubes  at 1300 rpm, discard supernatant, resuspend cells in adequate volume of cFAD/3T3J2  medium.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":28,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bnrdl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"80hbc","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cp0sh","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2k7oe","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"57v58","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9fgk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5b6r1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ado21","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1n33c","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-80","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"-130","unit":10}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"3":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9nh5n","text":"Add    Pen/Strep and complete medium. Store the 3T3-J2 medium at   and heat it before use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":65,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"ej8kq","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"1","error_concentration":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":206}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"4","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d0g4s","text":"When the cells have reached pre-confluency, trypsinize them. Briefly, wash 1x with PBS and add Trypsin/EDTA and put the flask in a 10% CO2 humidified incubator   for  . If cells are not well detached, add a bit more Trypsin/EDTA and incubate for    minutes more. Collect the cells and add some 3T3-J2 medium to stop tryptic action. Count the cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":137,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":160,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":166,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":246,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1nser","text":"Centrifuge the cells at 1300 rpm in a 15 ml tube for   or   for a 50 ml Falcon tube. Discard supernatant and add fresh 3T3-J2 medium.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":53,"length":1},{"key":4,"offset":58,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2f0do","text":"Split the cells as follows:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":900,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"E13366E8AE2911EE9FCF0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":false,"start":null,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":900,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"7E25E524AE2E11EE9FCF0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":false,"start":null,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"7E25E5B5AE2E11EE9FCF0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":false,"start":null,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"3":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"7E25E3A8AE2E11EE9FCF0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":false,"start":null,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"4":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":900,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"7E25E425AE2E11EE9FCF0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":false,"start":null,"temperature":"37","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"i43c","text":"Obtain 3T3-J2 from Kerafast (https://www.kerafast.com/item/1100/3t3-j2-cell-line). Plate the vial according the manifacturer's instructions in a humidified   10% CO2 incubator. Feed the 3T3J2 flask every 3 or 4 days.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":29,"length":51},{"key":1,"offset":156,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"A4665E8CAE2411EE9FCF0A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.kerafast.com/item/1100/3t3-j2-cell-line"}},"1":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"7B7C373BAE2E11EE9FCF0A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10,"url":"https://www.kerafast.com/item/1100/3t3-j2-cell-line"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7oifo","text":"Set up several flasks for feeder layer cells (10^5 to 10^6 cells per flask) or expanding the stock. Try to use pre-confluent flasks for feeder layer when growing keratinocytes (human epidermis, cornea, thymus, esophagus). Carry the line for no more than 14 passages. If the cells grow too fast, discard the batch.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
